alert.note: Alert for Mercer (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 1:33PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Tazewell, central Bland and Mercer Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 133 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gratton, or near Burkes Garden, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bluefield... Princeton... Tazewell... Athens... Matoaka... Rocky Gap... and Camp Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
